alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:04AM EST until January 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO BRING SLIPPERY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA EARLY THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT... .Light to moderate snow will overspread New Hampshire and western Maine late this morning into the afternoon and continue into tonight, making for a slippery commute in the afternoon and evening hours. Some freezing rain is also possible this evening and tonight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
